diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The patient presented with sudden onset of right lower quadrant abdominal pain, nausea, vomiting, diarrhea, and possible low-grade fevers. A CT scan showed a tubular structure in the expected region of the appendix measuring up to 9 mm, highly suspicious for appendicitis, along with reactive lymph nodes and free fluid in the pelvis, but no signs of abscess or perforation.
